article_title: Why a 40-Hour Worker Means More to Small Businesses
article_text:
Some small-business owners are hopeful that a new Congress will change the federal health law’s requirement that businesses provide health insurance to workers who clock as little as 30 hours a week, or pay a penalty.

Republicans taking over control of the Senate would like to extend the law’s definition of a full-time workweek to 40 hours or more. That move, which would require President Barack Obama’s approval, could benefit...
